title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm prepares for his first Bruins training camp as head coach, emphasizing intensity and accountability.
Sturm aims to improve the Bruins' 33-39-10 record by implementing new systems and player opportunities.
Bruins need improved defense and power play performance to regain competitiveness in the Eastern Conference.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Hubert, a Worcester man, is on trial for allegedly kidnapping and attempting to murder a girl in 2017.
The victim, now 15, testified that Hubert, a family friend, kidnapped her and threw her off a bridge into Lake Quinsigamond.
Hubert denied all charges, and the trial, delayed since 2020, is expected to continue throughout the week.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye dismissed concerns about handling the Patriots' complex offense, stating every NFL QB has a lot on their plate.
Maye's interception against the Raiders was pivotal, leading to 13 unanswered points in the Patriots' season-opening loss.
Bill Belichick banned Patriots scouts from UNC practices; Maye remains supportive of his alma mater despite the tension.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookie Will Campbell struggled in the Patriots' season opener, contributing to four team sacks and committing two false starts.
Veteran Morgan Moses emphasized learning from mistakes, noting rookie debuts are challenging due to limited film information.
Despite offensive line issues, Drake Maye had some protection, but Patriots scored only 13 points against their opponents.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte was originally a top high school prospect, comparable to NFL star Stefon Diggs.
Boutte's promising college career at LSU was hindered by an ankle injury, affecting his draft position.
Despite being a sixth-round pick, Boutte has excelled, notably with six catches and 103 yards in a season opener.

title: Hasbro is relocating its headquarters to Boston’s Seaport
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Hasbro announced its headquarters relocation to Boston's Seaport, moving from Pawtucket, Rhode Island after nearly 100 years.
The new location at 400 Summer St. will house 700 employees and encompass 265,000 square feet across seven floors.
Massachusetts officials, including Gov. Maura Healey and Mayor Michelle Wu, expressed support for Hasbro's move to Boston.

title: Wu heads into preliminary election with massive 50-point lead over Kraft
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Michelle Wu holds a 50-point lead over Josh Kraft in the recent Emerson College poll.
Emerson poll shows 72% likely voter support for Wu, 22% for Kraft, ahead of Boston's preliminary election.
Poll results indicate strong disapproval (77%) of National Guard deployment for crime control in Boston.

title: Dunkin’ franchisee closes down production plant, lays off 74 employees
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: NGP Management is permanently closing its Dunkin' facility in Haverhill, impacting 74 employees, effective early November.
The layoffs include varied roles such as 45 production workers, 21 drivers, managers, and a baker, beginning Nov. 3.
A new Dunkin' production plant is set to open by year-end at 30 Creek Brook Drive, Haverhill, serving the Merrimack Valley.

title: Bill Belichick statue at Gillette? Here’s what more than 1,000 readers said.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Patriots owner Robert Kraft hinted at a possible Bill Belichick statue during a WBZ interview.
A Boston.com poll revealed 46% support for Belichick statue, while 52% opposed the idea.
Supporters cite Belichick's role in six Super Bowl wins; critics highlight his contentious fan relationship.

title: Pair from Brighton facing charges in string of handicap placard thefts
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Andrea Doucette-Keating, 55, and Zachary Shelton, 37, from Brighton, are arrested for a series of handicap placard thefts.
Evidence from incidents on June 30 and August 14 led police to pinpoint Doucette-Keating as the primary thief, with Shelton organizing the operation.
Recovered evidence includes multiple stolen placards, a window punch, cocaine, and a BB gun from Shelton’s residence at 1662 Commonwealth Ave.
